text: You open the Streaming Telemetry processing agent configuration dialog from a workflow configuration. To open the Streaming Telemetry collection agent configuration, click Configuration  New Configuration . Select Workflow from the Configurations dialog. When prompted to select workflow type, select Realtime . Click Add Agent and select Streaming Telemetry from the Processing tab of the Agent Selection dialog. Open Streaming Telemetry processing agent configuration dialog Configuration option Description Configuration option Description Name Enter the name of the agent. Manage Error Routes Error Route Select the desired error route from the drop down list. TLS Settings Enable TLS Select this check box to enable TLS over HTTP/2. Security Profile Select the desired Security Profile holding the necessary credentials. Note! If you are migrating from an earlier major version of MediationZone 8.x the certificates will be migrated to a new security profile! Keep Alive Settings Enable Keep Alive Select this checkbox to enable keepalive pings on idle gRPC connections. Keep Alive Time (s) The number of seconds the connection can remain idle (no read activity) before a keepalive ping is sent. Default: 300 seconds Keep Alive Timeout (s) The number of seconds to wait for a response after sending a keepalive ping. If no activity is detected within this time, the connection is considered dead. Default: 10 seconds Enable Automatic Reconnect This option is enabled by default. When selected, the agent will automatically attempt to reconnect if a connection is lost. While reconnecting, it sends a warning UDR. If reconnecting ultimately fails, an error UDR is sent. If this option is disabled, the agent will not try to reconnect and will immediately send an error UDR when the connection is lost.
